about.title: Lead Fullstack Developer (Generalist)
about.WhoAmI: A Fullstack / Mobile Developer Located In Our Lovely Earth
about.description: With a background spanning software development roles at Oiika and E-Data Now!, along with project leadership at YHP, I've gained diverse experience in frontend and backend development. Additionally, my freelance consulting work has provided expertise in web and mobile development. This varied experience has equipped me with a versatile skill set and a deep understanding of software development across different domains.

eds.title: Computer Programmer Analyst
eds.description: I hold a three-year advanced diploma in Computer Programmer Analyst, with my final project focusing on leading a partnership to develop a mobile communication application for verbally limited individuals. This project utilized Xamarin for its cross-platform compatibility. Throughout the program, I gained proficiency in various technologies including PHP, ASP, Java, COBOL, SQL, MySQL, C#, C++, Visual Basic, QBasic, VISIO, Ubuntu, MS PowerPoint, Dreamweaver, MS FrontPage, phpMyAdmin, MS Project, MS Access, Android Studio, MS Excel, Visual Studio, and MS Word.

exps.title: Freelance
exps.description: Providing development consulting services primary with web and mobile development.

exps.title: Lead Full-Stack Developer
exps.descriptionOld: As the go-to problem solver, I tackled development roadblocks swiftly, ensuring project continuity. I led code base enhancements, improving team skills and delivering quality solutions. I evaluated task feasibility, offered alternatives, and facilitated collaboration on technical challenges. I provided accurate work estimations, guided team growth through coaching, and managed multiple projects efficiently. I oversaw merging and deployment, upgraded library dependencies, and conducted employee reviews. I led technical interviews and focused on aligning development efforts with YHP's strategic goals, primarily within the Wonderlab suite.
exps.description: Starting with a small team, I spearheaded the expansion efforts, progressively growing it to over 5 times its original size. Alongside team augmentation, I adeptly managed external resources to supplement our in-house capabilities, ensuring seamless integration and maximizing overall productivity. As the go-to problem solver, I tackled development roadblocks swiftly, ensuring project continuity. I led code base enhancements, improving team skills and delivering quality solutions. I evaluated task feasibility, offered alternatives, and facilitated collaboration on technical challenges. I provided accurate work estimations, guided team growth through coaching, and managed multiple projects efficiently. I oversaw merging and deployment, upgraded library dependencies, and conducted employee reviews. I led technical interviews and focused on aligning development efforts with YHP's strategic goals, primarily within the Wonderlab suite.
points: Spearheaded the expansion efforts (2 -> 10 developers, 3 projects)
Go-to problem solver including providing support for other teams
Led code base enhancements, improving team skills and delivering quality solutions.
Evaluated task feasibility, offered alternatives, and facilitated collaboration on technical challenges.
Provided accurate work estimations, guided team growth through coaching, and managed multiple projects efficiently.
Oversaw merging and deployment, upgraded library dependencies, and conducted employee reviews.
Led technical interviews and focused on aligning development efforts with YHP's strategic goals, primarily within the Wonderlab suite.

exps.title: Freelance
exps.description: Providing development consulting services primary with web and mobile development.

exps.title: Software Developer
exps.description: Worked as a Software Craftsman for “E-Data Now!” (EDN) product. EDN is a near real time data collection system. The primary use case is inspection and auditing in the automotive industry. Typically a user will perform audits using EDN Client (iOS/Swift/C++) and enter their Time sheet’s using EDN Time (Flutter/Dart). The data is pushed up to a Rails API, where it’s presented to the Web Administrators using a cutting edge Nuxt.js/Vue.js frontend stack. I had the opportunity to write code for the frontend, and backend while assisting with mobile bug fixes. Beyond my developer duties, I maintained test plans and test cases for the entire suite of EDN products. While performing testing duties, I was also mandated to write automated and load tests.
points: Excelled at my felid placement and landed a full-time job.
Worked on the frontend, backend, and mobile development stacks.
Lead the optimization pass, identifying and fixing api bottlenecks.

exps.title: Software Engineer
exps.description: Oiika was a web platform where passionate tutors and mentors share their knowledge with other individuals. (Mainly on the frontend) I worked on many random parts of this project, tasks grabbed from a ticket pool.

volunteers.title: Frontend Developer
volunteers.shortDescription: I volunteered at Crown International, where I developed the user profile page. This project involved creating an intuitive interface for managing user information and customizing profiles.
volunteers.longDescription: As a volunteer at Crown International, I took on the task of developing the user profile page. This project aimed to create a seamless and user-friendly interface for users to manage their personal information and customize their profiles. Using modern web development technologies, I focused on delivering a high-quality solution that enhanced the overall user experience. My responsibilities included designing the UI/UX, implementing frontend features using React, and ensuring the backend integration was smooth and efficient. This experience allowed me to contribute my skills to a meaningful project and further develop my expertise in web development.

volunteers.title: Hackathon Lead
volunteers.shortDescription: I volunteered at Mintbean, where I organized and ran hackathons. My role involved coordinating events, mentoring participants, and fostering a collaborative environment for developers to innovate and learn.
volunteers.longDescription: As a volunteer at Mintbean, I played a key role in organizing and running hackathons. My responsibilities included coordinating event logistics, promoting the hackathons, and ensuring a smooth execution. During the events, I mentored participants, provided technical guidance, and facilitated workshops to help developers improve their skills. I also focused on creating an inclusive and collaborative atmosphere, encouraging innovation and learning among attendees. This experience allowed me to contribute to the developer community, enhance my leadership abilities, and stay updated with the latest technologies and trends in software development.
